autoqchem package¶

Submodules¶

autoqchem.db_functions module¶

exception autoqchem.db_functions.InconsistentLabelsException¶

Bases: Exception

Raised when a set of molecules is inconsistently labeled

autoqchem.db_functions.db_check_exists(inchi, gaussian_config, max_num_conformers, conformer_engine) → tuple¶

Check if a molecule is already present in the database with the same Gaussian config (function, basis_set, number of conformers, conformer engine)

Parameters:

  • inchi (str) – inchi of the molecule

  • gaussian_config (dict) – gaussian config

  • max_num_conformers (int) – maximum number of conformers to generate

  • conformer_engine (str) – conformer engine used for conformer generation (rdkit or openbabel)

Returns:

tuple(exists(bool), list of tags that are associated with the molecule if it exists)

autoqchem.db_functions.db_connect(collection=None) → Collection¶

Create a connection to the database and return the table (Collection).

Parameters:

collection (str) – database collection name (optional)

Returns:

pymongo.collection.Collection

autoqchem.db_functions.db_delete_molecule(mol_id)¶

Delete molecule from DB, cascade all child objects: tags, descriptors and log files

Parameters:

mol_id (bson.objectid.ObjectId) – molecule id in the DB

autoqchem.db_functions.db_get_molecule(inchi, tags=[])¶

Get an rdkit molecule from DB conformer geometries

Parameters:

  • inchi (str) – inchi of the molecule

  • tags (list) – optional list of tags to narrow the search

Returns:

rdkit.Chem.Mol

autoqchem.db_functions.db_get_rdkit_mol(molecule_record) -> (<class 'rdkit.Chem.rdchem.Mol'>, <class 'list'>)¶

Get an rdkit molecule from DB conformer geometries

Parameters:

molecule_record (dict) – molecule record from the DB

Returns:

rdkit.Chem.Mol

autoqchem.db_functions.db_reweight_molecule(molecule_id) → None¶

If the weights do not sum to 1, reweight the conformers

Parameters:

molecule_id (string) – db id from the molecules collection

Returns:

autoqchem.db_functions.db_select_molecules(tags=[], substructure='', smiles='', solvent='ALL', functional='ALL', basis_set='ALL', molecule_ids=[]) → DataFrame¶

Get a summary frame of molecules in the database

Parameters:

  • tags (list) – a list of tags of the db records (if multiple an ‘OR’ is taken)

  • substructure (str) – substructure SMARTS string

  • smiles (str) – smiles string

  • solvent (str) – solvent filter

  • functional (str) – functional filter

  • basis_set (str) – basis_set filter

  • molecule_ids (list) – filter on specific molecule ids in the DB

Returns:

pandas.core.frame.DataFrame

autoqchem.db_functions.db_upload_conformation(mol_id, weight, conformation, log, check_mol_exists=True)¶

Upload single conformation features and log file to DB, requires a molecule to be present

Parameters:

  • mol_id (bson.objectid.ObjectId) – molecule id in the DB

  • weight (float) – conformation weight

  • conformation (dict) – extracted descriptors for the conformation

  • log (str) – log file for the conformation

  • check_mol_exists (bool) – check whether the molecule exists in the database, default is TRUE, not recommended to change

autoqchem.db_functions.db_upload_molecule(mol_data, tags, metadata, weights, conformations, logs) → ObjectId¶

Upload single molecule to DB and all child objects tags, features and log files for its conformations

Parameters:

  • mol_data (dict) – molecule identity data (inchi, connectivity, etc.)

  • tags (list) – list of tags to assign to this molecule

  • metadata (dict) – Gaussian metadata specifying the configuration of the calculation

  • weights (list) – conformation weights

  • conformations (list) – list of extracted descriptors for each conformation

  • logs (list) – list of log files for each conformation

Returns:

bson.objectid.ObjectId

autoqchem.db_functions.descriptors(tags, presets, conf_option, solvent, functional, basis_set, substructure='', smiles='') → dict¶

Retrieve DFT descriptors from the database

Parameters:

  • tags (list) – a list of tags of the db records

  • presets (list) – list of descriptor presets from ‘global’ (molecule level descriptors), ‘min_max’ (min and max for each atomic descriptor across the molecule), ‘substructure’ (atomic descriptors for each atom in the substructure)

  • conf_option (str) – conformer averaging option: ‘boltzmann’ (Boltzmann average), ‘max’ (conformer with highest weight), ‘mean’ (arithmetic average), ‘min’ (conformer with smallest weight), ‘any’ (any single conformer), ‘std’ (std dev. over conformers)

  • solvent (str) – solvent filter

  • functional (str) – functional filter

  • basis_set (str) – basis_set filter

  • substructure (str) – substructure SMARTS string

Returns:

dict

autoqchem.db_functions.descriptors_from_mol_df(mol_df, conf_option='max') → dict¶

Get and weight descriptors given a set of molecules and a conformer reweighting option. This function involves a large query from the DB

Parameters:

  • mol_df (pd.DataFrame) – dataframe returned by the autoqchem.db_functions.db_select_molecules function

  • conf_option (str) – conformer averaging option: ‘boltzmann’ (Boltzmann average), ‘max’ (conformer with highest weight), ‘mean’ (arithmetic average), ‘min’ (conformer with smallest weight), ‘any’ (any single conformer), ‘std’ (std dev. over conformers)

Returns:

dict

autoqchem.descriptor_functions module¶

autoqchem.descriptor_functions.occupied_volume(geometry_df, atom_idx, r, mesh_density=30) → float¶

Compute occupied volume fraction within a sphere of radius ‘r’ for an atom at position ‘atom_idx’. Each atom radius is taken to be its Van der Waals radius.

Parameters:

  • geometry_df (pd.DataFrame) – geometry dataframe, must contain ‘X’, ‘Y’, ‘Z’ and ‘AN’ (atomic number) columns

  • atom_idx (int) – index of the atom to use as ‘central’ atom

  • r (float) – occupied volume radius in Angstroms

  • mesh_density (int) – density of the mesh for numerical integration (MAX=100)

Returns:

float, occupied volume fraction

autoqchem.draw_utils module¶

autoqchem.draw_utils.draw(mol: Mol, energies: list = []) → <ipywidgets.widgets.interaction._InteractFactory object at 0x7fb5201d9fd0>¶

Make a drawing of all conformers in 3d

Parameters:

  • mol (rdkit.Chem.Mol) – rdkit molecule

  • energies (list) – list of conformer energies

Returns:

interact 3D object

autoqchem.gaussian_input_generator module¶

class autoqchem.gaussian_input_generator.gaussian_input_generator(molecule, workflow_type, directory, theory, solvent, light_basis_set, heavy_basis_set, generic_basis_set, max_light_atomic_number)¶

autoqchem.gaussian_log_extractor module¶

exception autoqchem.gaussian_log_extractor.NegativeFrequencyException¶

Bases: Exception

Raised when a negative frequency is found in the Gaussian log file. The geometry did not converge, and the job shall be resubmitted.

exception autoqchem.gaussian_log_extractor.NoGeometryException¶

Bases: Exception

Raised when Gaussian does not contain geometry information. Job failed early and cannot be fixed by resubmission.

exception autoqchem.gaussian_log_extractor.OptimizationIncompleteException¶

Bases: Exception

Raised when the optimization has not completed successfully.

class autoqchem.gaussian_log_extractor.gaussian_log_extractor(log_file_path)¶

Bases: object

check_for_exceptions()¶

Go through the log file and look for known exceptions, truncated file, negative frequencies, incomplete optimization, and raise a corresponding exception

get_atom_labels() → None¶

Fetch the atom labels and store as attribute ‘labels’.

get_descriptors() → dict¶

Extract and retrieve all descriptors as a dictionary.

Returns:

dict

get_geometry() → None¶

Extract geometry dataframe and store as attribute ‘geom’.

autoqchem.helper_classes module¶

class autoqchem.helper_classes.sge_job(can: str, inchi: str, inchikey: str, elements: list, charges: list, connectivity_matrix: ndarray, conformation: int, max_num_conformers: int, conformer_engine: str, tasks: tuple, config: dict, job_id: int, directory: str, base_name: str, status: sge_status, n_submissions: int, n_success_tasks: int)¶

Bases: object

Dataclass for SGE job.

Parameters:

  • can (str) – canonical smiles

  • inchi (str) – inchi

  • inchikey (str) – inchikey

  • conformation (int) – conformation number

  • charges (list) – formal charges for all atoms

  • connectivity_matrix (np.ndarray) – connectivity matrix

  • conformation – conformation number

  • max_num_conformers (int) – max number of conformers generated for the molecule

  • conformer_engine (str) – conformer engine

  • tasks (tuple) – gaussian tasks tuple

  • config (dict) – gaussian configuration parameters dictionary

  • job_id (int) – job id on the remote host

  • directory (str) – job local directory

  • base_name (str) – job local base_name

  • status (sge_status) – sge_status of the job

  • n_submission (int) – number of times the job has been submitted

  • n_success_tasks (int) – number of successfully completed tasks

class autoqchem.helper_classes.sge_status(value)¶

Bases: IntEnum

SGE job status enumerator.

created = 1¶

job files have been created and stored locally

done = 3¶

job finished successfully (all gaussian steps finished) and have been retrieved from host

failed = 4¶

job failed

incomplete = 5¶

job is incomplete, it should be resubmitted

submitted = 2¶

jobs has been submitted to SGE on remote host

uploaded = 6¶

job has been uploaded to the DB succesfully

class autoqchem.helper_classes.slurm_status(value)¶

Bases: IntEnum

Slurm job status enumerator.

created = 1¶

job files have been created and stored locally

done = 3¶

job finished successfully (all gaussian steps finished) and have been retrieved from host

failed = 4¶

job failed

incomplete = 5¶

job is incomplete, it should be resubmitted

submitted = 2¶

jobs has been submitted to slurm on remote host

uploaded = 6¶

job has been uploaded to the DB succesfully

autoqchem.rdkit_utils.generate_conformations_from_rdkit(smiles, num_conf, rdkit_ff='MMFF94') → tuple¶

Generate conformational ensemble using rdkit

Parameters:

  • smiles (str) – SMILES string

  • num_conf (int) – maximum number of conformations to generate

  • rdkit_ff (str) – force field that is supported by rdkit (MMFF94, MMFF94s, UFF)

Returns:

tuple(elements, conformer_coordinates, connectivity_matrix, charges)

autoqchem.rdkit_utils.get_light_and_heavy_elements(mol: Mol, max_light_atomic_number: int) → tuple¶

Extract light and heavy elements present in the molecule.

Parameters:

  • mol (rdkit.Chem.Mol) – rdkit molecule

  • max_light_atomic_number (int) – atomic number of the heaviest element to be treated with light_basis_set

Returns:

tuple(light_elements, heavy_elements

autoqchem.rdkit_utils.get_rdkit_mol(elements: list, conformer_coordinates: ndarray, connectivity_matrix: ndarray, charges: ndarray) → Mol¶

Construct an rdkit molecule from elements, positions, connectivity matrix and charges.

Parameters:

  • elements (list) – list of elements

  • conformer_coordinates (np.ndarray) – list of conformers 3D coordinate arrays

  • connectivity_matrix (np.ndarray) – connectivity matrix

  • charges (np.ndarray) – list of formal charges for each element

Returns:

rdkit.Chem.Mol

autoqchem.rdkit_utils.get_rmsd_rdkit(rdmol) → ndarray¶

Calculate RMSD row-wise with RDKit. This is a computationally slower version, but takes symmetry into account (explores permutations of atom order).

Parameters:

rdmol (rdkit.Chem.Mol) – rdkit molecule

Returns:

np.ndarray

autoqchem.rdkit_utils.prune_rmsds(rdmol, thres)¶

Get a list of conformer indices to keep

Parameters:

  • rdmol (rdkit.Chem.Mol) – rdkit molecule

  • thres (float) – RMSD threshold below which conformers are considered identical (in Angstrom)

Returns:

list(indices of conformers to keep)

autoqchem.rdkit_utils.rdmol_from_sge_jobs(jobs, postDFT=True) → Mol¶

Create and rdkit molecule from a set of sge jobs.

Parameters:

  • jobs (list) – list of jobs for the molecule

  • postDFT (bool) – if the DFT calculations are already available, the optimized geomtries will be used, if not the initial geometries.

Returns:

rdkit.Chem.Mol

autoqchem.rdkit_utils.rdmol_from_slurm_jobs(jobs, postDFT=True) → Mol¶

Create and rdkit molecule from a set of slurm jobs.

Parameters:

  • jobs (list) – list of jobs for the molecule

  • postDFT (bool) – if the DFT calculations are already available, the optimized geomtries will be used, if not the initial geometries.

Returns:

rdkit.Chem.Mol

autoqchem.sge_manager module¶

class autoqchem.sge_manager.sge_manager(user, host)¶

Bases: object

SGE manager class.

connect() → None¶

Connect to remote host.

create_jobs_for_molecule(molecule, workflow_type='equilibrium', theory='APFD', solvent='None', light_basis_set='6-31G*', heavy_basis_set='LANL2DZ', generic_basis_set='genecp', max_light_atomic_number=36, wall_time='23:59:00') → None¶

Generate sge jobs for a molecule. Gaussian input files are also generated.

Parameters:

  • molecule (molecule) – molecule object

  • workflow_type (str) – Gaussian workflow type, allowed types are: ‘equilibrium’ or ‘transition_state’

  • theory (str) – Gaussian supported Functional (e.g., B3LYP)

  • solvent (str) – Gaussian supported Solvent (e.g., TETRAHYDROFURAN)

  • light_basis_set (str) – Gaussian supported basis set for elements up to max_light_atomic_number (e.g., 6-31G*)

  • heavy_basis_set (str) – Gaussin supported basis set for elements heavier than max_light_atomic_number (e.g., LANL2DZ)

  • generic_basis_set (str) – Gaussian supported basis set for generic elements (e.g., gencep)

  • max_light_atomic_number (int) – maximum atomic number for light elements

  • wall_time (str) – wall time of the job in HH:MM:SS format

get_job_stats(split_by_can=False) → DataFrame¶

Job stats for jobs currently under management, optionally split by canonical smiles.

Parameters:

split_by_can (bool) – if True each canonical smiles will be listed separately

Returns:

pandas.core.frame.DataFrame

get_jobs(status=None, can=None) → dict¶

Get a dictionary of jobs, optionally filter by status and canonical smiles.

Parameters:

  • status (sge_status) – sge status of the jobs

  • can (str or list) – canonical smiles of the molecules, single string for one smiles, a list for multiple smiles

Returns:

dict

qstat(summary=True) → DataFrame¶

Run ‘qstat -u $user’ command on the server.

Parameters:

summary – if True only a summary frame is displayed with counts of jobs in each status

Returns:

pandas.core.frame.DataFrame

remove_jobs(jobs) → None¶

Remove jobs.

Parameters:

jobs (dict) – dictionary of jobs to remove

resubmit_incomplete_jobs(wall_time='24:59:00') → None¶

Resubmit jobs that are incomplete. If the job has failed because the optimization has not completed and a log file has been retrieved, then the last geometry will be used for the next submission. For failed jobs the job input files will need to be fixed manually and submitted using the function submit_jobs_from_jobs_dict(). Maximum number of allowed submission of the same job is 3.

Parameters:

wall_time – wall time of the job in HH:MM:SS format

retrieve_jobs() → None¶

Retrieve finished jobs from remote host and check which finished successfully and which failed.

submit_jobs() → None¶

Submit jobs that have status ‘created’ to remote host.

submit_jobs_from_jobs_dict(jobs) → None¶

Submit jobs to remote host.

Parameters:

jobs (dict) – dictionary of jobs to submit

upload_done_molecules_to_db(tags, RMSD_threshold=0.35) → None¶

Upload done molecules to db. Molecules are considered done when all jobs for a given smiles are in ‘done’ status. The conformers are deduplicated and uploaded to database using a metadata tag.

Parameters:

  • tags (list(str)) – a list of tags to create for this molecule

  • RMSD_threshold (float) – RMSD threshold (in Angstroms) to use when deduplicating multiple conformers after Gaussian has found optimal geometry

autoqchem.slurm_manager module¶

class autoqchem.slurm_manager.slurm_manager(user, host)¶

Bases: object

Slurm manager class.

connect() → None¶

Connect to remote host.

create_jobs_for_molecule(molecule, workflow_type='equilibrium', theory='APFD', solvent='None', light_basis_set='6-31G*', heavy_basis_set='LANL2DZ', generic_basis_set='genecp', max_light_atomic_number=36, wall_time='23:59:00') → None¶

Generate slurm jobs for a molecule. Gaussian input files are also generated.

Parameters:

  • molecule (molecule) – molecule object

  • workflow_type (str) – Gaussian workflow type, allowed types are: ‘equilibrium’ or ‘transition_state’

  • theory (str) – Gaussian supported Functional (e.g., B3LYP)

  • solvent (str) – Gaussian supported Solvent (e.g., TETRAHYDROFURAN)

  • light_basis_set (str) – Gaussian supported basis set for elements up to max_light_atomic_number (e.g., 6-31G*)

  • heavy_basis_set (str) – Gaussin supported basis set for elements heavier than max_light_atomic_number (e.g., LANL2DZ)

  • generic_basis_set (str) – Gaussian supported basis set for generic elements (e.g., gencep)

  • max_light_atomic_number (int) – maximum atomic number for light elements

  • wall_time (str) – wall time of the job in HH:MM:SS format

get_job_stats(split_by_can=False) → DataFrame¶

Job stats for jobs currently under management, optionally split by canonical smiles.

Parameters:

split_by_can (bool) – if True each canonical smiles will be listed separately

Returns:

pandas.core.frame.DataFrame

Get a dictionary of jobs, optionally filter by status and canonical smiles.

Parameters:

  • status (slurm_status) – slurm status of the jobs

  • can (str or list) – canonical smiles of the molecules, single string for one smiles, a list for multiple smiles

Returns:

dict

Remove jobs.

Parameters:

jobs (dict) – dictionary of jobs to remove

resubmit_incomplete_jobs(wall_time='24:59:00') → None¶

Resubmit jobs that are incomplete. If the job has failed because the optimization has not completed and a log file has been retrieved, then the last geometry will be used for the next submission. For failed jobs the job input files will need to be fixed manually and submitted using the function submit_jobs_from_jobs_dict(). Maximum number of allowed submission of the same job is 3.

Parameters:

wall_time – wall time of the job in HH:MM:SS format

Submit jobs to remote host.

jobs (dict) – dictionary of jobs to submit

upload_done_molecules_to_db(tags, RMSD_threshold=0.35) → None¶

Upload done molecules to db. Molecules are considered done when all jobs for a given smiles are in ‘done’ status. The conformers are deduplicated and uploaded to database using a metadata tag.

Parameters:

  • tags (list(str)) – a list of tags to create for this molecule

  • RMSD_threshold (float) – RMSD threshold (in Angstroms) to use when deduplicating multiple conformers after Gaussian has found optimal geometry
